an10.72:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof, together with several well known senior disciples.
an10.72:4.2: They included Venerables Cāla, Upacāla, Kakkaṭa, Kaṭimbha, Kaṭa, Kaṭissaṅga,
an10.72:4.3: and other well known senior disciples.
an10.72:5.1: Now at that time several well known Licchavis plunged deep into the Great Wood to see the Buddha. Driving a succession of fine carriages, they made a dreadful racket.
an10.72:5.3: “These several well known Licchavis have plunged deep into the Great Wood to see the Buddha. Driving a succession of fine carriages, they’re making a dreadful racket.
an10.72:5.4: But the Buddha has said that sound is a thorn to absorption.
an10.72:5.5: Let’s go to the Gosiṅga Sal Wood.
an10.72:5.6: There we can meditate comfortably, free of noise and crowds.”
an10.72:5.7: Then those venerables went to the Gosiṅga Sal Wood,
an10.72:5.8: where they meditated comfortably, free of noise and crowds.
an10.72:6.1: Then the Buddha said to the mendicants:
an10.72:6.2: “Mendicants, where’s Cāla, Upacāla, Kakkaṭa, Kaṭimbha, Kaṭa, and Kaṭissaṅga?
an10.72:6.3: Where have these senior disciples gone?”
an10.72:7.1: And the mendicants told him what had happened.
an10.72:8.1: “Good, good, mendicants! It’s just as those great disciples have so rightly explained. I have said that sound is a thorn to absorption.
an10.72:9.1: Mendicants, there are these ten thorns.
an10.72:9.3: Relishing company is a thorn for someone who loves seclusion. Focusing on the beautiful aspect of things is a thorn for someone who is committed to the meditation on ugliness. Seeing shows is a thorn to someone restraining the senses. Contemplating females is a thorn to celibacy. Sound is a thorn to the first absorption. Placing the mind and keeping it connected are a thorn to the second absorption. Rapture is a thorn to the third absorption. Breathing is a thorn to the fourth absorption. Perception and feeling are a thorn to the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling. Greed, hate, and delusion are thorns.
an10.72:10.3: Mendicants, live free of thorns and rid of thorns!
an10.72:10.4: The perfected ones live free of thorns,
